p: Archaeological deposits in Arctic areas are known to hold extraordinary well-preserved organic archaeological materials, primarily due to the cold temperatures and in some cases lack of water or oxygen within the depositional environments 1 2 3 4. In addition to the archaeological materials, the deposits are often rich in residues from animals, plants, insects, and pollen 5 6 and are therefore increasingly being recognized as valuable paleoclimatic and paleoenvironmental archives 7.
